articles.title: Twitter announces reversal of political advertising ban as Australian users report error messages, slow loading times - ABC News
articles.description: Twitter announces it will align its advertising policies "with that of TV and other media outlets" as Australians struggle with error pages and slow loading times.
articles.content:
Twitter has announced it will allow political advertising again as users in Australia continued to report difficulty accessing the social media platform.

articles.title: Harmer catch: Nortje says Proteas 'were convinced it's out' - News24
articles.description: Anrich Nortje says the Proteas were convinced that Simon Harmer’s slip catch on Australia's Marnus Labuschagne, given not-out, was out during the first day of the third Test at the SCG.

articles.title: OnePlus 11 5G and Buds Pro 2 will be available in China on January 9th - Yahoo Finance Australia
articles.description: The OnePlus 11 5G and OnePlus Buds Pro 2 will be available in China starting on January 9th before their worldwide release on February 7th.
articles.content: OnePlus has officially launched its new flagship phone and earbuds in China, more than a month before their global debut. The OnePlus 11 5G and OnePlus Buds Pro 2 will be available in the company's h… [+1385 chars]

articles.author: Melissa Cunningham
articles.title: COVID-19 subvariant wreaking havoc in US reaches Australia - Sydney Morning Herald
articles.description: A new COVID-19 subvariant that is spreading fast in the US has been detected in Australia, where high transmission rates have also led to the creation of the country’s own subvariants for the first time.

articles.title: Markets live: Australian shares set to rebound, Tesla and Apple drag Wall Street lower - ABC News
articles.description: Australian shares are likely to start the day higher, despite losses on Wall Street as oil prices slumped — along with shares of tech giants Apple and Tesla. Follow live.
articles.content:
Shares of Tesla dropped 12.2% overnight, which knocked nearly $US50 billion off its market value.
